title: Panettone
summary: Panettone (/ˌpænɪˈtoʊni/,[1][2][3] Italian: [panetˈtoːne]; Milanese: panetton [paneˈtũː])[4] is an Italian type of sweet bread originally from Milan, usually prepared and enjoyed for Christmas and New Year in Western, Southern, and Southeastern Europe as well as in Latin America, Eritrea,[5] Australia, the United States and Canada.[6]
